summary: This is an internal email chain from August 21, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing a public statement made by former Governor Bill Richardson's lawyer regarding Richardson's status in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails show prosecutors clarifying that their private conversation with the lawyer was inaccurately represented in the press release.

Brown acted as Richardson's counsel, offering his assistance to prosecutors and subsequently issuing a public statement on his behalf regarding his non-involvement in the case.

events.title: Internal email discussion about statement
events.description: Prosecutors internally discussed the Richardson press statement, with one noting their conversation with Brown was inaccurately represented and that they had contacted Brown to address the discrepancies.

keyFacts: Bill Richardson's lawyer, Jeff Brown, issued a public statement claiming prosecutors said Richardson was not a target, subject, or witness in the Epstein case and there was no active allegation against him.
Internal emails reveal prosecutors believed Brown's public statement did not 'fully accurately reflect' their private conversation with him.

A prosecutor clarified that in their call with Brown, they explained witness/subject/target distinctions and said they didn't have enough information to categorize Richardson as a witness or target, but did not state there were 'no allegations at all' against him.
The prosecutor noted they 'would never say to an attorney what we are or aren't investigating' regarding specific allegations.
After internal discussion, the prosecutor contacted Jeff Brown to address the discrepancies in his public statement and Brown said he would get back with how he proposed to address them.
